title: Anti-abortion center’s lawsuit against Mass. officials gets tossed
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A federal judge dismissed Your Options Medical's lawsuit against Massachusetts officials regarding a public education campaign on crisis pregnancy centers.
Judge Sorokin ruled the state campaign did not violate YOM's constitutional rights, despite using strong language about misleading practices.
YOM plans to appeal, arguing the state's conduct was a coordinated effort against them, but state officials' views were deemed allowable.

title: Bruins, Marco Sturm must do their ‘homework’ to fix team’s top flaw for stretch run
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Bruins rank 28th in the NHL with a penalty kill success rate of 76.4% this season.
Head coach Marco Sturm identifies improving the penalty kill as a primary focus during the Olympic break.
Boston is currently holding the second wild-card spot in the Eastern Conference with a record of 32-20-5.

title: This Boston Marathon bombing survivor is running with Miles for Miracles
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Juliana Hermenegildo, a Boston Marathon bombing survivor, will run the 2026 marathon with the Miles for Miracles team.
Hermenegildo is fundraising for Boston Children's Hospital, where her son Tiago underwent successful open-heart surgery.
Running the marathon is her way to heal from past trauma and support her son's treatment facility.

title: Teaming up with Al Horford against Celtics will be ‘weird,’ Kristaps Porzingis says
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Kristaps Porzingis and Al Horford, former Celtics, will play against Boston with the Warriors on Thursday.
Porzingis expressed it feels 'weird' to face his old team, marking his first game as a Warrior after injuries.
Horford reflects on his special connections with the Celtics and the positive impact of moving to the Bay Area.

title: Celtics reportedly bring back Dalano Banton on 10-day contract
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Boston Celtics signed Dalano Banton to a 10-day contract after his recent stint with the Clippers.
Dalano Banton, previously part of the 2024 Celtics team, averaged 2.3 points and 1.5 rebounds in that season.
Celtics also converted John Tonje's contract to a 10-day NBA deal after acquiring him from the Jazz.

title: Here’s why Ed Markey is boycotting the State of the Union — and what he and others are doing instead
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Senator Ed Markey will boycott President Trump's State of the Union, joining the 'People's State of the Union' rally instead.
The rally, organized by MoveOn and MeidasTouch, will feature Democratic lawmakers discussing impacts of Trump's policies alongside federal workers and immigrants.
House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries encourages Democrats to either boycott or silently attend Trump's speech; some will participate, others like Rep. Seth Moulton will attend.

title: South Boston St. Patrick’s Parade to follow new route for 250th Evacuation Day
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: The South Boston St. Patrick’s Parade will begin at Andrew Square instead of ending there on March 15.
The route change honors the 250th anniversary of Evacuation Day and Henry Knox's historic march.
New parade features include a 'family-friendly zone' at Medal of Honor Park to manage large crowds.

title: New England has the best open-air and maritime museums in America, according to USA Today readers
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Plimoth Patuxet Museums in Plymouth, Mass. was ranked the No. 1 open-air museum by USA Today's 2026 10Best Readers’ Choice Awards.
Maine Maritime Museum in Bath, Maine was recognized as the top maritime museum in the United States by USA Today readers.
Old Sturbridge Village, Mass. and Mystic Seaport Museum, Conn. were also highly ranked for open-air and maritime museums, respectively.

title: Second worker exposed to gas at Maine pulp mill dies
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Allen Hornberger, 26, died after being exposed to toxic gas at Woodland Pulp Mill in Baileyville, Maine, on January 27.
Hornberger, a North Collins, New York native, was a process engineer and valedictorian graduate in chemical engineering.
Kasie Malcolm, another worker, also died following the exposure during a shutdown operation at the bleach plant.

title: Warriors’ Stephen Curry to miss Thursday’s game against the Celtics
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Stephen Curry will miss Thursday's game against the Boston Celtics due to ongoing knee issues.
Curry has been dealing with runner's knee and has not played since January 30, missing 16 games this season.
Former Celtic Krastaps Porzingis will debut for the Warriors, while Al Horford is also set to play against Boston.
